newsitem.title: UK: UK natural gas output up 23 pct in Q3 96 vs 95.
newsitem.headline: UK natural gas output up 23 pct in Q3 96 vs 95.

text.p: Britain's production of natural gas rose by 23 percent in the third quarter of this year compared to the corresponding period in 1995, the Department of Trade and Industry said on Tuesday.

Total production of indigenous primary fuel - which includes gas, oil, coal, nuclear electricity, and hydro electricity - rose to 60.7 million tonnes of oil equivalent in the third quarter, 0.6 percent higher than in the same period a year ago.
Production of oil fell by three percent, coal by 9.6 percent and primary electricity by 4.8 percent. Only gas showed a sustained rise, attributed to its increased use in power generation.
